Vaccine

pfizer

In people ages 16 years and older, the Pfizer-BioNTech (COMIRNATY) vaccine was 95% effective at preventing laboratory-confirmed infection with the virus that causes COVID-19 in people who received two doses and had no evidence of being previously infected.

moderna

Moderna (mRNA COVID-19 vaccines), in people ages 18 years and older, was 94.1% effective at preventing laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 infection in people who received two doses and had no evidence of being previously infected.

astrazeneca

U.S. Clinical trials showed that beginning 2 weeks after the second dose, the AstraZeneca Vaxzevria COVID-19 vaccine was 74% effective in protecting trial participants against COVID-19.

Self Report

The currently reported cases on the official website does not take into account of those who test positive using the rapid test kit, but this data is also an important index for us to understand how serious our current situation is. Therefore, we make a calculation here.

The current count of self-test positive cases is:

0

If you self-test positive, please fill out the form below so that we can take you into account.
